intro: Senecio paulsenii subsp. paulsenii, commonly known as the Paulsen's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth form and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
